articles.title: Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments in North Phyongan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Inspects Industrial Establishments in North Phyongan
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to industrial establishments in North Phyongan Province.
					 The first leg of his guidance was the Ryangchaek Bearing Factory.
					
					 After being briefed on the modernization of the factory, he went round the processing shop and other places of the factory to acquaint himself in detail with its technological updating and production.
					
					 Expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the workers of the factory are successfully rebuilding the factory as required by the new century and effecting a steady surge in production, he highly appreciated their feats.
					
					 If modernization and scienfication based on the latest science and technology are realized while steadily strengthening the Juche character of the national economy as this factory is doing, it is possible to give full play to the advantages and vitality of our self-supporting national economy in all fields, he noted, adding that the revolutionary fighting spirit and enterprising work style of the workers of the factory making uninterrupted advances and innovations without moment's stagnation and marking time are the example to be followed by all the units. 
					
					 Noting that the nation's machine-building industry making rapid progress is requiring a steady boost of the production of bearing, one of the indispensable parts, he stressed that in order to find a satisfactory solution to this urgent problem it is necessary to decisively improve the quality of bearings and, at the same time, develop and perfect new varieties of diverse sizes. 
					
					 He said in order to bring about a radical turn in the bearing production it is necessary to continue dynamically pushing forward the modernization and scientization of the factory and, at the same time, pay primary attention to the work to introduce ultra-modern science and technology and raise the producers' level of technical skill. 
					
					 The next leg of his guidance was the Sinuiju Shoes Factory. 
					
					 He went round the room for the education in the revolutionary history.
					
					 The factory has developed to be a reliable shoes producer playing a big role in settling the shoes problem of our people under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung, he said, adding that seeing this factory alone, one can know well how devotedly the President worked for the improvement of the standard of the people's living.
					
					 Then he made the rounds of the sole shop and other production processes of the factory to learn in detail about its technological equipment and production.
					
					 He was greatly satisfied to learn that its workers are keeping production going at a high rate by putting the production processes on a modern and scientific basis.
					
					 He noted that in order to increase the production of shoes suited to the developing trend of the times, it is imperative to strengthen researches into this domain and, at the same time, steadily raise the level of technical skill of the producers and wage a dynamic drive to introduce advanced science and technology.
					
					 He praised the factory for having spruced up its interior like a palace and its exterior like a park and built all necessary cultural and welfare facilities, thus establishing a high level of cultured practices in production and life and providing the workers with good living conditions, underscoring the need to continue paying deep attention to this work.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the workers of the factory would creditably perform their honorable duty and thus produce and supply more quality shoes for the people of the country.
					
					 Then he saw varieties of grass crafts produced by the Sinuiju Grass Craft Production Cooperative to learn about its management and operation.
					
					 Expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the cooperative is making varieties of attractive and useful grass crafts with locally available raw materials and agricultural by-products including sedges and corn-shucks, thereby contributing to the improvement of the standard of the people's living, he highly praised its workers for devoting their wisdom and energy to the people.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Sinuiju Chicken Farm rebuilt on an expansion basis.
					
					 After being briefed on the farm in front of a huge map showing its panoramic view, he made the rounds of the computer control room   and the room for incubation and other places to acquaint himself in detail with its technological updating and production.
					
					 Expressing great satisfaction over the fact that the employees of the farm have made leaping progress in the production of meat and eggs by intensifying the technological updating of the production processes and putting the breeding on a scientific basis as required by the IT age, he praised them for having devoted their wisdom and energies to serving the people.
					
					 It is a success worth a high praise that in recent years this farm has boosted the production of meat and eggs with less production cost through a positive introduction of ultra-modern science and technology, thus making a great contribution to improving people's diet, he noted, adding that the experience of this farm proves that only when a farm is based on high level of science and technology can it bring about a fresh turn in poultry, too. 
					
					ã€€Saying that the reserve for boosting the production in the poultry, too, lies in solving the problem of breeding chicken, he underlined the need for the farm to continue thoroughly implementing the Party's policy of bringing about a radical turn in raising breeding chickens to positively introduce chickens of good stock which grow fast and are high in egg-laying rate, while consuming less feed. 
					
					 In order to keep the production at the chicken farm going at a high rate it is necessary to pay primary attention to solving the feed problem, he noted, stressing the need to decisively increase the grain yield in feed bases by increasing the production of organic composite fertilizer by use of excretion of chickens. 
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the workers of the farm would continue effecting a surge in production by fully displaying the popular character and thus make a positive contribution to improving the people's diet.
					
					 He said that the miraculous achievements made by North Phyongan Province recorded with creation and feats, racing against time, fully reflect the dynamism of the country dashing ahead towards the eminence of a thriving nation, adding that this eye-opening speed of advance is a great fruition of the indomitable will and inexhaustible mental power of the Korean people confidently advancing, remaining single-mindedly loyal to the Party despite any trial.
					
					 He was accompanied by Kim Phyong Hae, chief secretary of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK, Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and Pak Nam Gi and Jang Song Thaek, department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: DPRK Leaders Sent Message of Sympathy to Chinese Leaders
articles.content:
DPRK Leaders Sent Message of Sympathy to Chinese Leaders
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Kim Yong Il, premier of the Cabinet, Tuesday sent a message of sympathy to Hu Jintao, President of the People's Republic of China, and Wen Jiabao, Premier of the State Council, in connection with a gas explosion in a coal mine in Heilongjiang Province that claimed big casualties.
					 We send deep sorrow and condolences to you, the government and people of China and to the victims and their families, the message noted, expressing sincere hope that the people in the afflicted area would eradicate the aftermath of the accident and bring their living to normal as early as possible under the leadership of the Communist Party and the government of China.

articles.title: Talks Held between DPRK and Chinese Defense Ministers
articles.content:
Talks Held between DPRK and Chinese Defense Ministers
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Talks were held here Tuesday between Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and minister of the People's Armed Forces, and Col. General Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defense who doubles as a state councilor of the People's Republic of China.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, Col. General of the KPA Sim Sang Dae, Lieut. General of the KPA Kim Su Hak and other general officers and officers of the KPA and from the Chinese side were Col. General Huang Xianzhong, political commissar of the Shenyang Military Area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army, Lieut. General Feng Zhaoju, deputy commander of the Jinan Military Area, Vice Admiral Xu Hongmeng, deputy commander of the Nanjing Military Area and commander of the East Sea Fleet of the Navy, Lieut. General Jiang Jianzeng, deputy commander of the Nanjing Military Area and commander of the Air Force of the area, Maj. General Chai Shaoliang, organizational director of the General Political Department of the CPLA, Maj. General Wang Jin, vice-director of the Operation Department of the General Staff, Maj. General Jia Xiaoning, deputy director of the Foreign Affairs Office of the Ministry of National Defense, 
					
					 and other suite members and Ambassador Liu Xiaoming and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 At the talks both sides had an in-depth exchange of views on steadily developing the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the armies of the two countries and a series of matters of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Chinese Defense Minister Puts Wreath on Martyrs Cemetery
articles.content:
Chinese Defense Minister Puts Wreath on Martyrs Cemetery
Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Col. General Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defense who doubles as a state councilor of the People's Republic of China, laid a wreath at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Tuesday.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were his party, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming and the military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy.
					
					 Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and officers of the Korean People's Army were on hand.
					
					 The wreath in the name of the Chinese defense minister was placed at the cemetery.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the revolutionary martyrs.
					
					 Then they laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, and paid silent tribute to her.
					
					 Liang made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Chinese Defense Minister Puts Wreath on Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Defense Minister Puts Wreath on Friendship Tower
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Col. General Liang Guanglie, minister of National Defense who doubles as a state councilor of the People's Republic of China, laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower on Tuesday.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were the minister of National Defense and his party, and Ambassador Liu Xiaoming and the military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 On hand were Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and officers of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 The wreath in the name of the Chinese defense minister was laid before the tower.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of the martyrs of the Chinese People's Volunteers who bravely fought on the Korean front to beat back the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion. Then they looked round the tower. 
					
					 Liang made an entry in the visitor's book. 
					
					 Earlier, the Chinese defense minister placed a wreath at the cemetery of CPV martyrs in Hoechang County, South Phyongan Province and visited the former headquarters of the CPV.

articles.title: Chairman of Russian Federation Council Here
articles.content:
Chairman of Russian Federation Council Here
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, arrived here by air on Tuesday to visit the DPRK at the invitation of its Supreme People's Assembly.
					 He was accompanied by Aleksei Borodavkin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and other suite members.
					
					The guests were greeted at the airport by Kim Wan Su, vice-chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and officials concerned and the Russian ambassador to the DPRK and his embassy officials.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Meets Chairman of Russian Federation Council
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Meets Chairman of Russian Federation Council
Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Kim Yong Il met and had a friendly talk with Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia who paid a courtesy call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					Present there were Ri Ryong Nam, minister of Foreign Trade, Choe Pae Jin, vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission, officials concerned and Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Aleksei Borodavkin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia, Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and other suite members.

articles.title: Talks Held between Chairmen of DPRK and Russian Assembly
articles.content:
Talks Held between Chairmen of DPRK and Russian Assembly
Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Talks between Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Sergei Mikhailovich Mironov, chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, were held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday.
					 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were Deputy to the SPA Hong So Hon, chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Parliamentary Group, Kim Song Hui, deputy to the SPA, and officials concerned and from the Russian side Valery E. Sukhinin, Russian ambassador to the DPRK, Aleksei Borodavkin, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ruslan Tatarinov, director of the Secretariat of the Federation Council, Andrei Baklanov, director of the Bureau for International Relations of the Federation Council, Konstantin Pulikovski, advisor to the chairman of the Federation Council, and other suite members.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the SPA of the DPRK and the Federation Council of Russia and a series of issues of bilateral interest. 
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Surinamese President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Surinamese President
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Runaldo Ronald Venetian, President of Suriname, on the occasion of the 34th anniversary of its independence.
					 Kim in the message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Singaporean Foreign Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Singaporean Foreign Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk in a friendly atmosphere with the delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Singapore headed by Bilahari Kausikan, second permanent secretary of the ministry, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Tuesday when it paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Senior State Officials Enjoy Art Performance
articles.content:
Senior State Officials Enjoy Art Performance
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- An art performance of members of the itinerant art squads of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex, the Taean Heavy Machine Complex and the Tobacco Complex and the art group of the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory was given at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.
					 It was appreciated by senior party and state officials, the chairpersons of friendly parties and creators, artistes, journalists and editors in the fields of culture and art and media in Pyongyang.
					
					 Put on the stage were such colorful numbers as chorus "We Are the Happiest in the World", poem and story "We Will Inherit the Revolutionary Spirit of Mt. Paektu Forever", story of the history of revolutionary activities "Endless Supply of Milk with Eternal Love", mixed chorus "Push Back the Frontiers of Science", female solo "Song of Frontranker of Chollima Movement" and chorus and story telling "Vans of Loving Care for Children, Kings".
					
					The performers truthfully represented the revolutionary spirit of the heroic working class of the DPRK who enjoy a worthwhile life as frontrankers of the era and a core unit building an economic power and dynamically advance, loudly sounding the revolution and the general offensive.

articles.title: Korean-style Pavilion Built at German Embassy
articles.content:
Korean-style Pavilion Built at German Embassy
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A Korean-style pavilion "Jakmyong Pavilion" was built in the compound of the German embassy here.
					 A ceremony for the completion of the pavilion was held at the embassy on Tuesday.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Ryu Sung Rim, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Germany Friendship Association, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 On hand were Ambassador Thomas Schafer and staff members of the German embassy and Peter Hughes, British ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: New Records Set in Various Sports Events
articles.content:
New Records Set in Various Sports Events
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Championships was held in the DPRK.
					 New records were established in various events of the championships.
					
					 The world record was broken in the women's individual trap shooting event. And new records of the DPRK were established in eight categories of events including women's 10-meter air pistol individual and team events, women's skeet shooting team event, men's 25-meter rapid fire pistol team event and women's 25-meter sports pistol team event.
					
					 The old DPRK records were renewed in more than 20 categories of weightlifting, archery, swimming, track-and-field and cycling events.

articles.title: Pyongyang Univ. of Foreign Studies
articles.content:
Pyongyang Univ. of Foreign Studies
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang University of Foreign Studies greeted its 60th birthday.
					 President Kim Il Sung, who paid importance to the training of foreign language experts in the building of a new country, founded a university of foreign studies, the first of its kind in the country, in November, Juche 38 (1949).
					
					 He provided all educational conditions to the university so that it could continue teaching without letup in the period of the hard-fought war, in the period of postwar rehabilitation and construction and in the period of the socialist construction. And he visited Pyongyang School of Foreign Languages under the university and had a souvenir photograph taken with its teaching staff and students.
					
					True to the noble intention of the President, General Secretary Kim Jong Il saw to it that the university vigorously carries forward its proud history. He has given important teachings on several hundred occasions in the past and indicated in detail the orientation and contents of education of foreign languages and the management and operation of the university.
					
					 The university, which taught only one foreign language at the time of foundation, has developed into a comprehensive base for teaching foreign languages with four faculties, 46 departments and laboratories, a doctoral institute, simultaneous-interpretation institute, information centre, etc.
					
					The university honored with "Order of Kim Il Sung" has produced more than 30 heroes and personnel with academic degrees or titles including professors and doctors over last six decades. Tens of thousands of its graduates have made a great contribution to the prosperity and development of the country in various fields.
					
					 It has also edited various kinds of grand and pocket dictionaries and books, rendering great services for developing foreign language education.
					
					 Students of the university and school finished first and were awarded with the best prizes and the first class diplomas in the 5th, 6th, 11th and 12th International Russian Olympic Contests of Students, in the 5th and 6th World Student Chinese Language Contests and the 1st World Chinese Contest of Middle School Students.

articles.title: U.S. Scheme to Establish MD under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Scheme to Establish MD under Fire
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The commander of the SAC of the United States was reported to have asserted recently that the U.S. stepped-up moves to establish the missile defense system (MD) were aimed at coping with "threats" from such countries as Iran and it is necessary for the U.S. to counter such countries with the MD as its nuclear deterrent strategy dating back to the era of the Cold War does not prove efficient.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 The need to build missile shields underscored by the U.S. under the pretext of what it called "missile threat" is a brigandish logic and a height of impudence which can convince no one.
					
					 The basic aim sought by the U.S. in spreading the rumor about "missile threat" like a guilty party filing a suit first is to put spurs to the establishment of the MD under the pretext of "threat" in a bid to contain its potential rivals and keep maintaining and bolstering its military supremacy worldwide.
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to cover Northeast Asia and Eastern Europe and the rest of the world with its dense network of missiles, considering the building of missile shields as a deciding factor of its aggressive strategy for world domination.
					
					 It is clear to everybody that the world peace and security will be seriously threatened and disturbed and the danger of war will increase when the U.S. is allowed to go ahead with the building of missile shields as now.
					
					 No matter how crafty the U.S. may become in its moves to cover up its aggressive aim sought in building missile shields by spreading the above-mentioned rumor, it can never work in this bright world.
					
					The Cold War-minded way of thinking and mode of action are harmful at present when it has become a trend of the times to head for independence, and the U.S. wild ambition for world domination by force is nothing but a daydream.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the realities with a cool head and immediately halt its anachronistic moves to establish the MD disturbing the world strategic stability and sparking a new arms race and increasing the danger of a nuclear war.

articles.title: S. Korean Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket Flailed
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppets were recently reported to have become one of the co-sponsors of the so-called "resolution on human rights situation in the north" and voted for it at the UN.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 This was another unpardonable politically motivated provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 The "human rights" racket kicked up by them only betrays their ignorance about the DPRK and, at the same time, it is no more than a ridiculous political charade which can be staged only by those who do not know where they stand.
					
					 Lurking behind the anti-DPRK human rights racket persistently kicked up by the puppets even in the international arena, quite unaware of others' derision, is a sinister political aim to chill the hard-won atmosphere favorable for improving the inter-Korean relations and bedevil them.
					
					 Facts go to patently prove that the puppets are a group of traitors opposed to reunification steeped in the idea of confrontation in the political system and the consciousness of stand-off with fellow countrymen and bitterness towards them to the marrow of their bones.
					
					 The above-said racket kicked up by them to attain such sinister political aim only brings into bolder relief their despicable true colors.
					
					 They would be well advised to bear in mind that their frantic row to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK would only precipitate their bitter defeat and destruction.

articles.title: Indian Figure Meets WPK Delegation
articles.content:
Indian Figure Meets WPK Delegation
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A. B. Bardhan, general secretary of the National Council of the Communist Party of India, Sunday met and had a talk with the delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Pak Kyong Son, vice department director of its Central Committee, participating in the 11th international meeting of communist and workers' parties.
					 The general secretary said the relations between the two parties are the precious friendly relations provided by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					The noble will of Kim Il Sung is being translated into brilliant reality by Kim Jong Il, General Secretary of the WPK, he noted, and went on:
					
					We deeply admire the fact that the WPK and the Korean people under the wise leadership of
						 Kim Jong Il have victoriously advanced the revolution and construction, resolutely frustrating the U.S. imperialists' moves to stifle the DPRK.
					
					Kim Il Sung put forward the proposals for the reunification of Korea during his lifetime and
						 Kim Jong Il has wisely led the struggle for the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 The Communist Party of India will make every possible effort to boost the friendly relations with the WPK.

articles.title: Czech Organizations Denounces S. Korean Provocation
articles.content:
Czech Organizations Denounces S. Korean Provocation
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association and the Czech Group for the Study and Materialization of the Juche Idea issued a statement on November 17 denouncing the military provocation perpetrated by the south Korean bellicose forces.
					 The statement recalled that when the patrol boat of the Navy of the Korean People's Army was sailing back after confirming an unidentified object that intruded into the territorial waters of the DPRK on Nov. 10, a group of warships of the south Korean forces chased it and perpetrated such a grave provocation as firing at it.
					
					 The south Korean forces' ceaseless maneuvers for a war of aggression against the DPRK indicate that the south Korean military authorities remain unchanged in their wild ambition to stifle the DPRK by force, it held, and continued:
					
					 The recent armed provocation in the waters of the West Sea was not an accidental case but a deliberate provocation of the south Korean military authorities to escalate the tension on the Korean Peninsula. The warmongers fond of playing with fire will have to pay dearly for their provocation.
					
					 The statement demanded that the south Korean military authorities make a prompt apology to the DPRK for their reckless military provocation and immediately stop it.

articles.title: DPRK Important Days Marked in Various Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Important Days Marked in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Peru, a film show and a photo exhibition in Singapore and a film show in Trinidad and Tobago between Nov. 5 and 17 to mark the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk.
					 Displayed in the exhibition hall were photos on the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il and the Korean people's efforts for building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, said at the seminar that the eye-opening reality of the DPRK is ascribable to the wise leadership of Kim Il Sung, eternal president of the Korean people, and Kim Jong Il. He added that the younger generation should deeply study the reality of socialism and politics in the DPRK and strive to build Korean-style socialism in Peru, too.
					
					 Roberto Carbonel Pezo, chairman of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for Study of the Juche-based Songun Policy, said it is a shining fruition of the Songun politics pursued by Kim Jong Il that the DPRK has firmly defended socialism, frustrating the moves of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces for aggression.
					
					 The participants of the film shows watched Korean films "The Boundless Honor and Happiness of the Nation" and "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".

articles.title: Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Observed in Oceania
articles.content:
Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth to Be Observed in Oceania
Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- An Oceanian regional preparatory committee was inaugurated to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Don Borrie, chairman of the New Zealand-DPRK Society, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events on the above-said occasion.

articles.title: Victorious Self-Reliance Team
articles.content:
Victorious Self-Reliance Team
 Pyongyang, November 24 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave field guidance to a mine in the spring of Juche 73 (1984).
					 After acquainting himself with the actual condition that some officials wanted to buy and use highly efficient foreign-made deep-boring machines, the leader instructed the officials to organize a production emulation between a deep-boring machine made at the Rakwon Machine Complex (RMC) and other ones.
					
					 He took relevant measures, inquiring into the daily and weekly emulation results.
					
					 The scientists and technicians dispatched to the spot adapted the RMC-made deep-boring machine for the actual conditions of the mine, in concert with the producer masses.
					
					 As a result, the performance of the RMC-made machine grew day by day and its production jumped, taking the first place in the emulation.
					
					 Informed of the emulation result, he said that, after all, the self-reliance team placed first with undisputed scores in the game between those living on their own strength and those relying on others.
					
					 He earnestly instructed the officials that they should believe in workers of Rakwon and its deep-boring machine, stressing that they should continue to carry forward the tradition of self-reliance with credit.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno la Fabrica de Herramientas de Unsan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige sobre terreno la Fabrica de Herramientas de Unsan
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno la Fabrica de Herramientas de Unsan encendiendo la antorcha que llamara a registrar un viraje radical en la produccion de herramientas.
					Ante todo, recorrio la sala de presentacion del historial guiado por los funcionarios directivos de la fabrica.
					
					Senalo que bajo la sabia direccion y minuciosa atencion del Presidente Kim Il Sung, esta fabrica se ha convertido en la fidedigna base de produccion de herramientas que durante varios decenios pasados viene contribuyendo mucho a la industria de maquinaria del pais.
					
					En su recorrido por el taller de taladro y otros lugares de la fabrica, se entero detalladamente del estado de equipos tecnicos y produccion y estimulo cordialmente a los obreros que luchan por aumentar la produccion ahorrando el tiempo.
					
					Aprecio mucho el espiritu de lucha de los obreros de la fabrica mostrandose muy satisfecho de que ellos marcharan a pasos firmes hacia la cima de la gran potencia prospera llenos de confianza y optimismo hoy tambien con el temperamento heroico de la clase obrera coreana al emplear aquel espiritu e impetu con que producian las herramientas desde la nada superando tremendas dificultades del periodo posbelico.
					
					Destaco que resolver satisfactoriamente el problema de herramientas, que resulta la base de la industria de maquinaria, es una de las premisas del desarrollo de esta rama.
					
					En particular, nuestra industria, que llevo a cabo la conversion de los equipos en los mas rapidos y precisos mediante la introduccion total del sistema de produccion con la autoctona maquina herramienta CNC y se desarrolla vertiginosamente superando lo sofisticado, demanda mayor cantidad de herramientas convenientes de alto nivel, senalo.
					
					Y exhorto encarecidamente a la clase obrera de la fabrica a registrar una innovacion que traiga un viraje trascendental en la produccion de herramientas.
					
					Anadio que si se suministran en lo suficiente las herramientas modernas que esten basadas en las ciencias y tecnicas de punta, nuestra autoctona industria, cuyo nucleo es la de maquinaria, daria un salto al nivel mas alto.
					
					Para registrar una innovacion en la produccion de herramientas, hay que realizar audaz y ambiciosamente la reconstruccion tecnica de la fabrica y cambiar radicalmente su fisonomia, indico y presento las tareas combativas para convertirla dentro de un ano en la magnifica planta ejemplar de la epoca del Songun (priorizacion militar) dotada de tecnicas de punta.
					
					Enseno que si bien es una tarea muy dificil terminar en el corto tiempo de un ano la enorme obra de reconstruccion tecnica de la fabrica, es posible cumplirla con adelanto gracias a la inagotable potencia espiritual de la heroica clase obrera de Corea ilimitadamente fiel al partido y la revolucion y al confiable sosten de la autoctona industria poderosa.
					
					Expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que la clase obrera de la fabrica contribuira al desarrollo de la economia nacional segun metodos del Juche, modernos y cientificos al alcanzar orgullosos exitos en la innovacion de herramientas.
					
					Le acompanaron el secretario responsable del Comite del PTC en la Provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, Kim Phyong Hae, el secretario del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Pak Nam Gi y Jang Song Thaek.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam y Kim Yobg Il envian telegrama a sus homologos chinos
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam y Kim Yobg Il envian telegrama a sus homologos chinos
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y el premier del Consejo de Ministros Kim Yong Il, enviaron el dia 24 un telegrama de consuelo al presidente de la Republica Popular China Hu Jintao y el primer ministro del Consejo de Estado Wen Jiabao en relacion con que ocurrieron muchas perdidas humanas debido al accidente de la explosion de gas en una mina de carbon en la provincia de Heilongjiang.
					Los remitentes expresan su profunda simpatia y consuelo a los destinatarios, el gobierno y el pueblo de China, las victimas y sus familiares y desean de todo corazon que los habitantes de la zona damnificada bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China y el gobierno chino eliminen cuanto antes las consecuencias del accidente y gocen de la vida estabilizada.

articles.title: En Pyongyang Serguei Mironov
articles.content:
En Pyongyang Serguei Mironov
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Llego el dia 24 por via aerea a esta capital el presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Sergei Mijailovich Mironov, para realizar una visita a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea cumplimentando la invitacion de la Asamblea Popular Suprema.
					 Arribaron junto con el el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin, el director del Secretariado del citado Consejo Andrei Baklanov, el director del Buro de Relaciones internacionales de dicho Consejo Konstantin Pulikovski, el asesor del presidente del Consejo y otros acompanantes.
					
					En el aeropuerto los huespedes rusos fueron recibidos por el vicepresidente de la APS, Kim Wan Su, y otros funcionarios coreanos, el embajador y otros miembros de la embajada rusa en Corea.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il se reune con Serguei Mijailovich Mironov
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il se reune con Serguei Mijailovich Mironov
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, departio el dia 24 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae en el ambiente amistoso con el presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia, Serguei Mijailovich Mironov, quien le hizo una visita de cortesia.
					 En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicepresidente del Comite Estatal de Planificacion Choe Pae Jin y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					 Igualmente participaron el embajador ruso en Corea Valery Sukhinin, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin, el director del Secretariado del Consejo de Federacion Ruslan Tatarinov, el director del Buro de Relaciones internacionales de dicho Consejo Andrei Baklanov, el asesor del presidente del Consejo Konstantin Pulikovski y otros acompanantes.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre los presidentes de APS de Corea y CF de Rusia
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre los presidentes de APS de Corea y CF de Rusia
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 24 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre Choe Thae Bok, presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y Serguei Mijailovich Mironov, presidente del Consejo de Federacion de Rusia.
					 A la cita asistieron por la parte coreana el diputado a la APS y presidente del Grupo de Parlamentarios de Amistad Corea-Rusia Hong So Hon, la diputada a la APS Kim Song Hui y otros funcionarios, y por la rusa, el embajador en Corea Valery Sukhinin, el vicecanciller Alexei Borodavkin, el director del Secretariado del Consejo de Federacion Ruslan Tatarinov, el director del Buro de Relaciones internacionales de dicho Consejo Andrei Baklanov, el asesor del presidente del Consejo Konstantin Pulikovski y otros acompanantes.
					
					 En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron  opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los parlamentos de los dos paises y otros asuntos de interes mutuo.
					
					 Las conversaciones transcurrieron en un ambiente amistoso.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela objetivo agresivo de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela objetivo agresivo de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 24 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el comandante de la fuerza aerea estrategica de Estados Unidos hablo de que fortalecer el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles por su pais es para hacer frente a la "amenaza" de Iran y otros paises y anadio que hay que enfrentarles con el sistema antimisiles porque la estrategia de disuasivo nuclear de EE.UU. del periodo de la guerra fria no surte efecto para esos paises.
					EE.UU. da enfasis a la necesidad del establecimiento de tal sistema hablando de la supuesta "amenaza de misiles", lo cual es una logica bandidesca y una absurdidad inaceptable por nadie.
					
					Senala asi el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido el dia 24 y continua:
					
					El objetivo principal de EE.UU. de difundir el rumor de la "amenaza de misil" reside en dar acicate al establecimiento del sistema antimisiles bajo el pretexto de tal "amenaza", contrarrestar a los rivales permanentes y, a la larga, seguir manteniendo e intensificando la heguemonia militar en el ambito mundial. 
					
					EE.UU. pone el destino de la estrategia agresiva de dominacion al mundo en el establecimiento del sistema en cuestion y pretende encubrir con la red de sus misiles el Nordeste Asiatico, la Europa Oriental y el resto del mundo.
					
					Es evidente para todos que si se acelera como ahora el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles de EE.UU., se veran amenazadas gravemente la paz y la seguridad del mundo y se agrandara el peligro de la guerra.
					
					Por mas astutamente que maniobre EE.UU. difundiendo la doctrina de la "amenaza de misiles" de alguien para ocultar el objetivo agresivo del establecimiento del sistema antimisiles, no convencera a nadie en el mundo tan claro como hoy.
					
					En la actualidad en que la independencia constituye la corriente de la epoca, el modo de pensar y actuar a la manera de la guerra fria es enteramente inutil y la ambicion del imperio de dominar con fuerza al mundo no pasa de ser una vana ilusion.
					
					EE.UU. debe darse clara cuenta de la realidad y poner fin ahora mismo al complot de tal sistema antimisiles que destruira la estabilidad estrategica del mundo y acarreara la nueva carrera armamentista, la guerra nuclear.
